item.title: Angela add a quote by Ellen DeGeneres
item.description: "You know, it's hard work to write a book. I can't tell you how many times I really get going on an idea, then my quill breaks. Or I spill ink all over my writing tunic." -- Ellen DeGeneres

item.title: Angela add a quote by Langston Hughes
item.description: "Life is for the living. Death is for the dead. Let life be like music. And death a note unsaid." -- Langston Hughes

item.title: Angela add a quote by Judith Viorst
item.description: "Strength is the capacity to break a Hershey bar into four pieces with your bare hands - and then eat just one of the pieces." -- Judith Viorst

item.title: Angela add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "If you are allergic to a thing, it is best not to put that thing in your mouth, particularly if the thing is cats." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Angela add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You have brains in your head. You have feet in your shoes. You can steer yourself any direction you choose. You're on your own. And you know what you know. And YOU are the one who'll decide where to go..." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Angela add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Angela add a quote by Edward Albee
item.description: "What I mean by an educated taste is someone who has the same tastes that I have." -- Edward Albee

item.title: Angela add a quote by Robert Bloch
item.description: "Despite my ghoulish reputation, I really have the heart of a small boy. I keep it in a jar on my desk." -- Robert Bloch

item.title: Angela add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "It was a bright cold day in April, and the clocks were striking thirteen." -- George Orwell

item.title: Angela add a quote by Coco Chanel
item.description: "The most courageous act is still to think for yourself. Aloud." -- Coco Chanel

item.title: Angela add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Happiness consists in getting enough sleep. Just that, nothing more." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Angela add a quote by Tina Fey
item.description: "Some people say, “Never let them see you cry.” I say, if you’re so mad you could just cry, then cry. It terrifies everyone." -- Tina Fey

item.title: Angela add a quote by Joseph Brodsky
item.description: "There are worse crimes than burning books. One of them is not reading them." -- Joseph Brodsky

item.title: Angela add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "Love does not consist of gazing at each other, but in looking outward together in the same direction." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Angela add a quote by Glen Cook
item.description: "Morning is wonderful. Its only drawback is that it comes at such an inconvenient time of day." -- Glen Cook

item.title: Angela add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Words can be like X-rays if you use them properly -- they’ll go through anything. You read and you’re pierced." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Angela add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "I solemnly swear that I am up to no good." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Angela add a quote by Diane Duane
item.description: "Reading one book is like eating one potato chip." -- Diane Duane

item.title: Angela add a quote by W.C. Fields
item.description: "I am free of all prejudice. I hate everyone equally. " -- W.C. Fields

item.title: Angela add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "Why did you do all this for me?' he asked. 'I don't deserve it. I've never done anything for you.' 'You have been my friend,' replied Charlotte. 'That in itself is a tremendous thing." -- E.B. White
